definition: to sweep away evil/to purge (the world of crime)
to get rid of/to remove/to exclude/to eliminate/to wipe out/to divide/except/not including
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
a manly man/a man of character
to regulate the family and rule the state (idiom)
to bring peace and stability to the country
to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost/same as 鞠躬盡瘁|鞠躬尽瘁[ju1 gong1 jin4 cui4]
succeed or fail, sharp or blunt (idiom); advantages and disadvantages/success and failure/You win some, you lose some.
lit. sincerity splits open metal and metal (idiom); if you put your heart to it, you can break up metal and rocks/With a will, you can achieve anything.
pinyin: jing1 cheng2 suo3 jia1 , jin1 shi2 wei4 kai1

definition: great person of the past/venerable forebear/the great and the good
